results.title: Young and proud
results.creator_credit: Leah Latham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A young, successful and proud Yamatji woman, Leah Latham attributes the person she is today to growing up with different cultures. She acknowledges it can be hard being a mix of English and Indigenous cultures, but believes it has also made her the person she is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leah Latham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Risk and forecasting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Shows how an analysis of all sources of industrial risks must be taken into account to ensure that enterprise is successful and long-living.

results.title: Miss Navy
results.creator_credit: Margaret Morton, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Margaret Morton’s first time in the navy was short lived, as she contracted pneumonia which further developed into tuberculosis, just six months after joining. This meant Margaret spent an extended period of time hospitalised and in isolation, an experience she found frustrating and lonely. Morton describes the memories she still holds dear from her short time in service.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margaret Morton, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Quality control
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Industry controls the quality of its product by keeping a check on the variable factors in manufacturing; men, machines, materials, manufacturing conditions, etc. This film describes factors in setting quality standards on manufacturing cost and selling price.

results.title: A Story to inspire
results.creator_credit: Tanika Deemal-Parker, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Tanika Deemal-Parker has been singing all her life. She has been encouraged by her mum to take her singing further and, when doubts set in, it was her mum that helped her through with some words of wisdom.

results.title: The Knock at the door
results.creator_credit: Helen Raw, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: War has followed Helen all her life. As a young girl, she wrote letters to her brothers overseas and she had feared losing her husband in the Vietnam war. That dreaded knock on the door was something she never wanted to hear.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Helen Raw, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Production control. Part I
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The systematic procedure by which management regulates production to meet fluctuating demand consists of four main steps; routing, scheduling, despatching, and follow-up. This film develops the firs step, fully showing the basic importance of routing in manufacture.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The systematic procedure by which management regulates production to meet fluctuating demand consists of four main steps; routing, scheduling, despatching, and follow-up. This film develops the firs step, fully showing the basic importance of routing in manufacture.
description_for_label:

results.title: Over in 3 weeks
results.creator_credit: Tom Ross, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Once Tom Ross and his fellow soldiers settled in Singapore, the bombing started. In three weeks, they were captured and sent to Changi, where Ross was a prisoner of war for three and a half years. Despite the abject conditions, Ross managed to survive through sheer determination and will to live.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Ross, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Once Tom Ross and his fellow soldiers settled in Singapore, the bombing started. In three weeks, they were captured and sent to Changi, where Ross was a prisoner of war for three and a half years. Despite the abject conditions, Ross managed to survive through sheer determination and will to live.

In three weeks, they were captured and sent to Changi, where Ross was a prisoner of war for three and a half years. Despite the abject conditions, Ross managed to survive through sheer determination and will to live.

results.title: Grandma Jessie
results.brief_description: In this very personal story, Stephanie King pays tribute to her Grandma Jessie and reflects on the influence her upbringing by her grandmother has had on her own education and outlook.
